## Checklist

### Code Quality

- [ ] My code follows the project's style guidelines
- [ ] I have performed a self-review of my code
- [ ] I have commented my code, particularly in hard-to-understand areas
- [ ] My changes generate no new warnings or errors

### Testing

- [ ] I have added tests that prove my fix/feature works
- [ ] New and existing unit tests pass locally
- [ ] Any dependent changes have been merged and published

### Documentation

- [ ] I have updated the documentation accordingly
- [ ] I have updated the API specs if endpoints changed
- [ ] I have added/updated docstrings for new functions

### Security

- [ ] I have not introduced any security vulnerabilities
- [ ] Sensitive data is not logged or exposed
- [ ] Input validation is implemented where needed

## Reviewer Guidelines

<!-- For reviewers - don't edit this section -->

<details>
<summary>ğŸ“‹ Review Checklist (for reviewers)</summary>

### Code Review
- [ ] Code is readable and follows conventions
- [ ] Logic is correct and handles edge cases
- [ ] No obvious performance issues
- [ ] Error handling is appropriate

### Testing
- [ ] Tests are meaningful and comprehensive
- [ ] All CI checks pass

### Security
- [ ] No hardcoded secrets or sensitive data
- [ ] Input validation is present
- [ ] No SQL injection, XSS, or other vulnerabilities

### Documentation
- [ ] Public APIs are documented
- [ ] Complex logic has comments

</details>
